column13: Under the hashtag #AllTogetherDifferent, we have begun to build this identity, sense of belonging and togetherness internally and externally to strengthen our brand and employee value proposition. #AllTogetherDifferent is also coming to life via a partnership between our Global DEI and Health & Safety Teams.

column4: Freedom of Association and Collective Bargaining
column6: Operations and suppliers in which the right to freedom of association and collective bargaining may be at risk
column7: As set out in the Code of Conduct, Brambles respects our employeesÃ¢ÂÂ right to join, form, or not to join a labour union without fear of reprisal, retribution, intimidation or harassment. Where a legally recognized union represents employees, we are committed to establishing a constructive dialogue with their freely chosen representatives. Brambles is committed to bargaining in good faith with such representatives.

column6: Operations and suppliers at significant risk for incidents of child labor
column7: Brambles will not tolerate child labour in its operations and those of its suppliers. We believe all labour is harmful, exploitative or destructive if it begins too early. As a result, we do not employ childrenÃ¢ÂÂand we do not do business with suppliers or other third parties who employ childrenÃ¢ÂÂunder the age of 15, under the age for completing compulsory education, or under the minimum age for employment in the country, whichever is higher. In addition, we will not employ any child under the age of 18 years if they may be engaged in work that could be categorised as hazardous, and we will not tolerate suppliers or third parties who do so.

column6: Operations and suppliers ar significant risk for incidents of forced or compulsory labor
column7: As set out in the Code of Conduct, Brambles prohibitsÃ¢ÂÂin its operations and those of its suppliersÃ¢ÂÂthe use of all forms of forced labour, including prison labour, indentured labour, bonded labour, military labour, slave labour, and any form of human trafficking. Brambles recognises that one of the most vulnerable groups can be migrant workers who have travelled within the country or from overseas to obtain employment. To offer the greatest protection to this class of workers, Brambles ensures that (1) migrant workers have the same entitlements as local employees; (2) the company must cover any commissions and other fees associated with the employment of migrant workers, not the migrant workers; and (3) migrant workers are not required to turn over their identification documents, except as is briefly necessary to verify identity and employment eligibility.

column13: CHEP is proud to partner with and support FoodForward SA to help it achieve its mission of providing South Africans in need with quality surplus food received from farmers, manufacturers and retailers in a safe, costÃ¢ÂÂeffective way while fighting the impact of food loss and waste on the environment.

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column8: Partnership renewal with Global Food Banking Network (GFN)
column13: The renewal of the partnership with GFN for another three years will continue to leverage our supply chain and network position to support GFN in combating food insecurity and food waste across nearly 50 countries worldwide. This partnership renewal comes a year after renewing a three-year partnership with the European Food Banks Federation (FEBA). The collaboration with GFN started in 2016, and in FY23 alone, we have supported GFN in reaching over seven million individuals who need food relief.
column20: GFN partnership, Food insecurity, Food waste

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: A key focus of the 2023 CHEP Canada and Pallecon National Meeting was supporting food banks as food insecurity reached an all-time high. Since 2021, there has been a 15% increase in food bank traffic in Canada. The local teams proactively engaged with manufacturing and retail partners and organised a silent auction drive, raising ~US$30,000 and donating over 54,800 kg of food.
column20: Food bank support, Food insecurity, Community engagement

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column8: Fruitful Partnership with CHEP helps Montague provide Foodbank
column13: A proud and longstanding supporter of Foodbank in Australia, Montague works with CHEP to ensure fresh produce can reach those most in need. Apples and stone fruit are packed into CHEP bins straight from Montague's orchards and sent to Foodbank warehouses nationwide, seven days a week. A zero-waste approach also ensures that entire crops can be utilised Ã¢ÂÂ some being repurposed into meals or juice Ã¢ÂÂ to extend shelf life and divert from landfills.
column20: Foodbank support, Food insecurity, Zero waste approach

column6: Operations with significant actual and potential negative impacts on local communities
column8: Benefits for local communities in Tabasco Project
column13: Collaborating with local farmers and landowners fosters job opportunities and sustainable income streams. For every 10 hectares of reforestation, one new forestry role is created, and one highly skilled Forest Engineer is required for every 500 hectares. It also supports talent development as professional qualifications are necessary in forestry.
column20: Farmer collaboration, Job opportunities, Sustainable income

column6: Operations with significant actual and potential negative impacts on local communities
column13: The Helping Hand Programme in Australia donates A$50,000 annually to support community causes nominated by employees. It has funded over 35 initiatives in just two years, including food relief, sports, disease research, ecological restoration, and a literacy programme. The programme has high employee engagement and record nominations this year.
column20: Helping Hand Programme, Community support, Employee engagement

column13: Brambles launched its first Supplier Academy to introduce our key suppliers to Brambles' Sustainable Procurement Programme. This programme evolves how we partner with our suppliers: It encourages responsible supply chain practices to regenerate and restore nature and protect and strengthen our communities. It helps us meet our ambitious commitments to generate growth together.
